content:
• Wednesday, December 31, 2014

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RDNT +4.5%. CEMP +4.3%. ONVO +4.2%. INSY +4.0%. LPI +3.9%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RUSS -9.5%. HTA -4.8%. PES -3.8%. MTRX -3.8%. DNOW -3.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM
  • RESN

    Resonant soars to new highs on last day of 2014

    • Resonant (RESN +12.6%) blasted off on the last day of a volatile 2014. After falling as low as $4.93 in October, shares are now up nearly 2x from May's $6 IPO price.
    • The RF filter tech developer, still in development stage and carrying just a $71M market cap, has found multiple supporters among SA authors (I, II).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • SSNI

    Silver Spring closing out 2014 with big gains

    • New Year's Eve is providing a silver lining for beaten-down Silver Spring (SSNI +6.4%). Though still down 60% YTD due to the top-line pressures caused by deal push-outs, shares are now up 22% from an early-December low of $6.90.
    • Raymond James made a bull case for the smart grid networking tech provider last month. "When flipping on the light switch, most of us don't bother to think about the prospect of attacks against the power grid that can cause widespread, even catastrophic power outages ... In this context, Silver Spring stands out as one of the few publicly traded companies with significant leverage to the theme of protecting critical grid infrastructure from cyber attacks and other emerging threats."
    • Silver Spring's 2015E EV/sales ratio is down to 0.9. Revenue is expected to grow 14% in 2015 after declining 18% in 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • MOSY

    MoSys up 13.1% on solid volume

    • MoSys (NASDAQ:MOSY) is closing out a rough 2014 on a very strong note. Volume (216K shares) has topped a 3-month daily average of 158K.
    • The networking SRAM maker is still ending the year down 67% YTD. It's expected by the Street to see revenue rise 155% next year to $13.8M, but to nonetheless post a $0.49/share loss (slightly better than 2014's $0.55/share).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • SLCA

    U.S. Silica up 4.9% thanks to fresh insider buys

    • U.S. Silica (NYSE:SLCA) CEO Bryan Shinn discloses he bought 4K shares yesterday at $25.43. Director Peter Bernard bought 5K shares at $25.41.
    • COO Peter Winkler has also bought shares in December following SLCA's oil price-driven plunge, as have directors Michael Stice, Charles Shaver, and William Kacal.
    • SLCA is closing the year down 23% YTD, and 64% from a September high of $73.43.
    • Yesterday: Fracking sand plays sell off again
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 2 Comments

  • Commodities closing out year with thud

    • A tough year for commodity prices continues all the way into the close of the last session, with precious metals, energy, grains, and most of the softs slumping sharply. 2014's big commodity winner, naturally, stands alone in the green today - coffee is up 2%.
    • The PowerShares DB Commodity Index Tracker (DBC -1.9%)
    • Alongside the commodity slump, both this year and this session, is a stronger dollar, set to close 2014 out at its highest level in at least five years.
    • ETFs: DBC, DJP, GSG, RJI, GCC, USCI, GSC, GSP, RGRC, DJCI, LSC, DEE, UCI, FTGC, CMD, DYY, BCM, DDP, UCD, CMDT, COMT, DPU, SBV, CSCB, PDBC, CSCR
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • IMRS

    Imris capital raise breathes fresh air into shares

    • Nano cap penny stock Imris (IMRS +21.4%) moves north again on an 8x surge in volume. Shares have quadrupled since December 19, albeit still under $1.
    • On December 24, the company closed a private placement of 10.6M units at $0.284 per unit. Each unit consists of one share of common stock and 1.25 warrants at an exercise price of $0.3692 per common share per whole warrant. Gross proceeds were ~$3M.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • TSL

    Chinese solars rally after Brean raises M&A possibilities

    • Given recent government comments about supporting M&A (along with various policy incentives) to strengthen the Chinese solar industry, Brean thinks smaller firms could be snapped up, thereby providing a stronger supply/demand and pricing environment for bigger names.
    • Trina (TSL +7.9%), JA Solar (JASO +3%), Yingli (YGE +1.8%), JinkoSolar (JKS +4%), and Daqo (DQ +4.7%) are higher on a quiet New Year's Eve trading day. Trina might also be getting a lift from announcing it has set a new record (324.4Wp) for "power output from a high efficiency multi-crystalline silicon PV module." The accomplishment follows the development of a solar cell with 20.76% efficiency.
    • This year has seen debt-laden LDK Solar (OTCPK:LDKYQ) strike a restructuring deal and get moved to the pink sheets; shares are currently at $0.08. Last year, Suntech's Wuxi, China unit filed for bankruptcy and was later sold to solar cell maker Shunfeng Photovoltaic.
    • Last week: Chinese solar firms reportedly looking to build overseas plants
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 3 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: NRX +173%. SIBC +35%. OTC:MEIL +23%. REN +23%. LIME +20%. CALA +20%. MIG +19%. CBMG +18%. GBR +18%. BCLI +17%.
    • Losers: NDRM -25%. RCMT -20%. CJJD -17%. DRAM -15%. FATE -13%. FUR -13%. ABAC-OLD -10%. GNI -10%. KEG -10%. AGRX -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • VEON

    Russian tech/telecom stocks closing the year with more losses

    • VimpelCom (VIP -6.1%), MTS (MBT -4.3%), Yandex (YNDX -2.6%), and Qiwi (QIWI -2.4%) are ending what has been a very tough year for nearly any Russia-related investment on a down note.
    • The government's statistics ministry stated today 2014 inflation is expected to come in at 11.4% thanks to the ruble's plunge. Food prices are expected to post a 15.4% increase, non-food products an 8.1% increase, and service charges a 10.5% increase. Consumer prices are up 2.6% M/M in December.
    • YTD declines: YNDX -58%. QIWI -63%. VIP -68%. MBT -65%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • PEIX

    Pacific Ethanol merging with Aventine; shares slump

    • Pacific Ethanol (PEIX -5%) is merging with Midwestern ethanol maker Aventine Renewable Energy in an all-stock deal. Pacific is issuing 17.75M shares (current value of $181M), and assuming $135M in term loan debt.
    • Aventine's production capacity (spread out over four mills) totals 315M gallons/year, handily eclipsing Pacific's 200M. After factoring Pacific's ethanol marketing ops, the company expects to sell 800M+ gallons of ethanol annually post-merger (#5 in the U.S.).
    • Pacific: "With this transaction, Pacific Ethanol strengthens its unique production and marketing advantages by diversifying into two additional discrete markets and connecting its Western markets with Aventine's Midwest and Eastern markets." The deal is expected to close in Q2 2015.
    • Shares have sold off after initially trading higher in response to the deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • CLF

    Cliffs up 4.9% as iron ore prices bounce

    • Iron ore prices, cut nearly in half this year thanks to a supply glut driven by Australian miners, has bounced over the last several trading days. Beaten-down Cliffs Natural (NYSE:CLF) has risen in response.
    • "In terms of price downside, the worst is probably over," says Morgan Stanley's Tom Price. Ore prices are now roughly flat for December; bulls are hoping relaxed Chinese lending policies will lift demand.
    • Cliffs rallied along with other coal miners yesterday. Shares are closing out the year down 72% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 4 Comments
  • ATOS

    Atossa tries to reverse two-day slide

    • Nano cap Atossa Genetics (ATOS +16.4%) climbs northward on a 3x surge in volume in early trading. Shares sold off 30% the past two days.
    • Previously: Atossa up on heavy volume (Dec. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • SIGM

    Sigma Designs +6.1%; Needham sees a 4K TV/IoT play

    • CES (runs from Jan. 6-9) should highlight how Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM) is a play on both 4K TV and IoT growth, predicts Needham's Quinn Bolton, hiking his target by a dollar to $8 and reiterating a Buy.
    • Bolton is upbeat on the prospects for both Sigma's SX6 smart TV SoC (supports 4K playback), as well as its Z-Wave wireless home automation/monitoring platform.
    • Shares have made new 52-week highs, and are up 45% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 1 Comment

  • Crude oil bounces on inventory drop

    • Crude inventories fell 1.8M barrels last week vs. estimates for just a 100K barrel decline and the previous week's gain of 7.3M.
    • Gasoline (NYSEARCA:UGA) stocks rose 3M barrels vs. 2.1M estimates, and distillates (NYSEARCA:UHN) rose 1.9M vs. 1.5M estimates.
    • Down around $52.50 per barrel ahead of the number, WTI crude quickly spiked $1, and has since settled down to $53.10.
    • USO -1.6%
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UCO, SCO, BNO, DTO, DBO, CRUD, UWTI, USL, DWTI, DNO, SZO, OLO, TWTI, OLEM
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • BCLI

    Brainstorm Cell up on clinical trial results

    • Thinly-traded nano cap Brainstorm Cell Therapeutics (BCLI +22.7%) jumps on a 6x surge in volume in response to CEO Tony Fiorino's positive comments about the final results from the Phase 2a study of NurOwn in ALS patients.
    • Management will host a conference call on January 5 at 8:30 am ET to discuss the data.
    • Previously: BrainStorm to start Phase 2 ALS trial (April 28)
    • Stem cell-related tickers: (CUR +3.8%)(STEM)(NBS +0.5%)(OTCQB:ISCO +1.4%)(PSTI +2.2%)(NVIV -1.5%)(FCSC +1.6%)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • LUV

    Party hats for airline stocks to end the year

    • Airline stocks are in rally mode again off of momentum driven by the latest slide in oil prices.
    • Southwest Airlines (LUV +2.2%) is poised to end the year as the top performing stock of the S&P 500 Index with a +125% rip.
    • Though jet fuel hedging strategies vary widely throughout the sector, a prolonged period of lower oil prices will allow all carriers to realize a benefit.
    • Gainers: Republic Airways (RJET) +4.4%, United Continental (NASDAQ:UAL) +2.4%, Virgin America (NASDAQ:VA) +1.9%, JetBlue (NASDAQ:JBLU) +1.8%, Alaska Air Group (NYSE:ALK) +1.7%, Allegiant Travel (NASDAQ:ALGT) +1.6%, Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL) +1.6%, SkyWest (NASDAQ:SKYW) +1.4%.
    • Previous: Hedging strategies by airline
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 2 Comments
  • TRIL

    Trillium Therapeutics up premarket

    • Recent IPO Trillium Therapeutics (NASDAQ:TRIL) is up 8% premarket on modest volume. The Toronto, Canada-based preclinical-stage firm develops cancer therapies. It began its corporate life in 2004 as Neurogenesis Biotech, then changed to Stem Cell Therapeutics in 2013. Its current incarnation comes from its merger with Trillium Privateco in June.
    • Trillium Privateco began its corporate life 1996 as XenoTransplantation. Later it became Transplantation Technologies and then Trillium Therapeutics. Trillium Privateco merged with the special purpose Trillium subsidiary, 2364556 Ontario, in April 2013 in a reverse merger transaction before the June amalgamation.
    • 20-F
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: NRX +180%. MIG +18%. NEON +9%. PEIX +7%. CYTK +7%. BCLI +6%. ARWR +6%.
    • Losers: NDRM -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • NRXGQ

    NephroGenex up big on Pyridorin safety study

    • Thinly-traded nano cap NephroGenex (NRX) is up a whopping 188% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a cardiac safety study on its lead product candidate Pyridorin (pyridoxamine dihydrochloride) for reducing the rate of disease progression in patients with diabetic nephropathy (DN) due to type 2 diabetes.
    • Pyridorin showed no effect on the QT/QTc interval at the expected therapeutic dose of 300 mg as well as at a higher dose of 1200 mg. This is consistent with the results observed in Phase 1 and 2 trials. This is important because many DN patients have cardiovascular disease and other therapies carry risks to cardiac safety.
    • There are ~6M DN patients in the U.S.
    • Pyridorin inhibits pathogenic oxidative chemistries that are collectively elevated in diabetics. These chemistries induce pathological changes that are implicated in the development of DN.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • PERI

    Perion -2.9% premarket following Chardan downgrade

    • Perion (NASDAQ:PERI) has slumped to new 52-week lows in premarket trading, after Chardan Capital downgraded shares to Neutral after the bell yesterday.
    • Shares -64% YTD. They now sport an 2015E EV/sales ratio of just 0.8.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM
  • RDHL

    RedHill's European MAA for Bekinda accepted

    • The UK Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) validates RedHill Biopharma's (NASDAQ:RDHL) Marketing Authorization Application (MAA) for Bekinda (ondansetron) for the prevention of chemotherapy- and radiotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting. The company expects to receive feedback from the MHRA regarding the application in H2 2015.
    • The MAA was submitted to several member states under the European Decentralization Procedure. The UK is the Reference Member State.
    • Shares are up 21% premarket on moderately-higher volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:54 AM
